iana.encoding_considerations:
Character encodings may be specified within an SBE message schema.

Security considerations: Simple Binary Encoding is strictly a 
   presentation layer protocol, and makes no claim to safety at 
   session or application layers. Data consists of a stream of octets
   of either fixed or variable length. Users must take care to avoid 
   buffer overruns and should verify that data conforms to specified 
   data types. This format is not intended for active context, such 
   as executable code.

Interoperability considerations: Implementers may demonstrate 
   interoperability with others by publishing results of 
   fix-sbe-conformance test suite, published as open source by FIX 
   Trading Community.

Published specification: Simple Binary Encoding standards are 
   published by FIX Trading Community at 
   https://www.fixtrading.org/standards/sbe/ and 
   https://github.com/FIXTradingCommunity/fix-simple-binary-encoding

Applications which use this media: Simple Binary Encoding was 
   conceived as a binary message encoding of FIX Protocol, 
   standardized by FIX Trading Community. SBE was optimized for 
   market data and trading that require low latency is applicable to 
   any high performance messaging need.

Fragment identifier considerations: N/A

Restrictions on usage: None

iana.template_text:
(registered 2020-04-14, last updated 2020-04-14)

Media type name: application

Media subtype name: sbe

Required parameters: None

Optional parameters: None

Encoding considerations: binary

   Character encodings may be specified within an SBE message schema.

Security considerations: Simple Binary Encoding is strictly a 
   presentation layer protocol, and makes no claim to safety at 
   session or application layers. Data consists of a stream of octets
   of either fixed or variable length. Users must take care to avoid 
   buffer overruns and should verify that data conforms to specified 
   data types. This format is not intended for active context, such 
   as executable code.

Interoperability considerations: Implementers may demonstrate 
   interoperability with others by publishing results of 
   fix-sbe-conformance test suite, published as open source by FIX 
   Trading Community.

Published specification: Simple Binary Encoding standards are 
   published by FIX Trading Community at 
   https://www.fixtrading.org/standards/sbe/ and 
   https://github.com/FIXTradingCommunity/fix-simple-binary-encoding

Applications which use this media: Simple Binary Encoding was 
   conceived as a binary message encoding of FIX Protocol, 
   standardized by FIX Trading Community. SBE was optimized for 
   market data and trading that require low latency is applicable to 
   any high performance messaging need.

Fragment identifier considerations: N/A

Restrictions on usage: None

Additional information:

   1. Deprecated alias names for this type: N/A
   2. Magic number(s): N/A
   3. File extension(s): N/A
   4. Macintosh file type code: N/A
   5. Object Identifiers: N/A

General Comments:


Person to contact for further information:

   1. Name: Donald L. Mendelson
   2. Email: donmendelson&silver-flash.net

Intended usage: Common

   High performance messaging

Author/Change controller: FIX Trading Community incorporated as FIX 
   Protocol Ltd. <fix&fixtrading.org>
